text: just now I spoke on the phone with
President rouhani of the Islamic
Republic of Iran a historic phone call
capping a week-long visit by Iranian
president Hassan rouhani the visit was a
flurry of activity rowhani's Twitter
stream was constant and he seemed eager
to publicly extend a hand to the west I
bring peace and friendship from Iranians
to Americans we told him that we
appreciated the new tone the new
language used by him and members of his
government but ever-present pressure
from the west to go further and
political considerations back in Tehran
I want to know you your position on the
Holocaust on Tuesday mr. rouhani created
a political firestorm just by condemning
Nazi action during World War two Fars a
semi official news agency and highly
influential voice in Iran immediately
jumped in they said the translation was
incorrect and noted that mr. rouhani had
not specifically used the term Holocaust
we can then the crimes by Nazis in the
world war two and regrettably those
crimes were committed against many
groups many people and many people were
killed including a group of Jewish
people on the other side he faced
criticism for not going far enough we
will not be fooled by half measures that
merely provide a smokescreen for Iran's
continual pursuit of nuclear weapons and
the world should not be fooled either it
was a pattern repeated throughout the
week mr. rouhani charmed diplomats but
didn't offer concrete proposals he
mulled whether or not to shake president
obama's hand but skipped a lunch where
he might have had the chance cheers
he heads home with many issues still on
the table most pressingly questions
about Iran's nuclear program is rouhani
genuinely trying to move Iran and how
far can he go with resistance at home
those are questions that swirled around
him all week the tensions were on full
display when mr. rouhani arrived back in
Tehran video acquired by the New York
Times captured the scene as he left the
Tehran airport you can see mr. Rohani
himself in the distance hardline
protesters hurled eggs and a shoe at the
president while supporters offered
thanks time will tell whether Iran's
political landscape will truly allow
rouhani's words to turn into actions the
very fact that this was the first
communication between an American and
Iranian president since 1979 underscores
the deep mistrust between our countries
but it also indicates the prospect of
moving beyond that difficult history
